intro: Chloraea alborosea, commonly known as the white-veined chloraea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking white and green veined leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
